The ecosystem would collapse: Insects play a crucial role in the ecosystem, from pollinating plants to breaking down dead plants and animals. If all insects disappeared, the food chain would collapse, and many species of plants and animals would become extinct.
The world would be darker: Insects are responsible for producing a significant portion of the world's oxygen through photosynthesis. If all insects disappeared, the world would be much darker.

Humans would be unable to pollinate crops: Insects are responsible for pollinating many of the crops that humans eat. If all insects disappeared, humans would be unable to grow many of their favorite foods, leading to widespread food shortages and malnutrition.

The economy would suffer: Insects are used in many industries, including agriculture, medicine, and tourism. If all insects disappeared, these industries would suffer, leading to economic losses and job losses.

The world would be silent: Insects make up a significant portion of the world's soundscape. If all insects disappeared, the world would be much quieter, and many of the sounds that humans take for granted would be lost forever.
